divs: Sighting DetailsI was watering the garden in the evening as usual, and I was scanning the sky and enjoying the fading light. I remember the sky was completely clear and light blue. The sun was already down behind the mountain ridge. As I was gazing up a bright orange cigar shaped object rapidly traveled across the sky from west to east. The object was moving at an incredible speed- faster than anything I have ever seen, including satellites in orbit. The object was a perfectly shaped ellipse with sharp well defined edges. There was no contrail, nor any other visible disturbance in the sky. There was no sound I could detect. It was a very calm and quiet summer evening. The object passed from horizon to horizon in about 5 seconds. I neither saw nor heard any other aircraft before or after the event. I had the impression the object was very large and traveling at a very high altitude- 15,000 to 20,000 feet or more. I am an aircraft buff and routinely observe aircraft whenever they are overhead. There is no possibility that this object was any conventional craft, at least one I am familiar with. After the object passed from view I continued to watch the sky and wrap my brain around what I had just witnessed. I finished watering the garden and went inside to tell every one what I had seen. I said I had seen a UFO and the family thought that was neat. The kids went outside hoping to see something too. We did not witness any other events.
Summary: Bright orange object flew from western horizon to eastern horizon at an incredible speed - no visible trail - definitely not an astronomical object.
